p: After the antibiotics intake by human body, they would be transferred due to hydroxylation, cracking, and glycosidase acidification and so on a series of metabolic reactions to generate the product of inactive [43], [44]. However, most of the antibiotics cannot be fully utilization, and metabolism of pharmaceuticals is not higher than 15% [43]. Most of the antibiotics are water soluble; hence, it would go out of the patient body along with urine. Though some of them will not be dissolved or used, they would be eliminated from patient body to the environment through the patientâ€™s feces.
